revision.text:
{{About|the American comedian|other people with the same name|James Gregory (disambiguation)}} <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:James Gregory caricature.gif|thumb|James Gregory's familiar caricature, which appears on most of his album and video covers.]] --> '''James Gregory''' (born 1946) is an [[United States|American]] [[stand-up comedian]].<ref name ="Style1">Patrick, Jessica [http://carycitizen.com/2015/01/12/comedian-james-gregory-comes-cary/ Comedian James Gregory Comes to Cary] ''Cary Citizen''. May 13, 2015</ref><ref>Ho, Rodney [http://radiotvtalk.blog.ajc.com/2015/03/27/j-anthony-brown-james-gregory-come-full-circle-at-the-punchline-closing-out-sunday-march-29/ J Anthony Brown, James Gregory come full circle at the Punchline, closing out Sunday, March 29] ''Atlanta Journal Constitution''. May 12, 2015</ref>
He was born in [[Lithonia, Georgia|Lithonia]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] in 1946, and he worked as a salesperson until he was 36 years old, when he first began introducing performers at The Punch Line comedy club in [[Atlanta]]. His first feature act at the Punch Line was February 17, 1982.<ref>Wake, Matt [http://www.al.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2012/12/james_gregory_5_things_to_know.html James Gregory: 5 things to know about the 'Funniest Man In America'] ''Huntsville Times''. May 12, 2015</ref>
Some of his most notable works include an album and a book titled ''It Could Be A Law, I Don't Know'' and a video called ''Grease, Gravy & John Wayne's Momma''. Gregory's style consists of storytelling and contains no vulgarity.<ref name="Style1" /><ref>[http://www.myfoxal.com/story/29012791/good-day-alabama-may-8-2015 Good Day Alabama: May 8, 2015] ''Fox 6 WBRC''. May 12, 2015</ref>
Gregory has appeared regularly as a guest on several [[Television syndication|syndicated]] [[radio shows]], including the ''[[John Boy and Billy Show]]'', ''[[Rick and Bubba]]'', the ''[[Bob and Tom Show]]'', and ''[[Steve and DC]]''.
